text.0:
An image of the @StandardKenya front page claiming that lawyer Paul Gicheru told the ICC that he knows who killed former Cabinet Minister Mutula Kilonzo is ALTERED.

The real headline from that day's issue was of a different story: https://t.co/br5SNKS4IR
text.1:
A tweet with multiple images claiming to show infrastructure development in Uganda is PARTLY FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: Some of the photographs were taken in Equatorial Guinea: https://t.co/JbUyqeMXlC
text.2:
A Facebook post with a photo of a large crowd claiming it was shot in Uganda during a Bobi Wine rally is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:camera_with_flash: The photo is of the 2014 launch of Julius Malema’s manifesto in South Africa: https://t.co/OmoFacYqrW
text.3:
An article published on Opera News with a witness statement allegedly written by a Kenyan lawyer, Paul Gicheru, and submitted to the International Criminal Court is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The spokesperson for the ICC confirmed that the statement is not genuine: https://t.co/Twg82RW58U
text.4:
A Facebook post with a claim that the member of parliament for Uganda's Rushenyi County, Mwesigwa Rukutana, has bowed out of the race for the parliamentary seat is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:magnifying_glass_tilted_right: The MP, who is also the State Minister for Labour, has refuted the claim: https://t.co/3cpQO3AkS9
text.5:
A Facebook post with a photo claiming that Uganda's president Yoweri Museveni is giving out UGX 200,000 to participants for forwarding a chain message is :cross_mark: FALSE.

:money_with_wings: The presidential press secretary says the message promoting the giveaway is a scam: https://t.co/xj4wDDVjyY
